availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Stokes (Marshall County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Son of Elisha Stokes and Sarah Stokes. Resident of Trigg County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 360B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Marshall County, p. 144.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Birmingham District, p. 41.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 95.
